Key Match Events: Netherlands produced a stunning upset to knock South Africa out of the T20 World Cup with a 13-run victory at Adelaide Oval.
Player of the Match Colin Ackermann scored an unbeaten 41 from 26 balls, helping Netherlands' late charge.
Brandon Glover took 3 wickets for 9 runs and Fred Klaassen took 2 wickets for 20 runs for the Netherlands.
South Africa's pursuit faltered after the loss of openers Quinton de Kock (13) and Temba Bavuma (20).
Klaassen had Aiden Markram caught by Stephan Myburgh, and Glover dismissed David Miller for 17 and Wayne Parnell for a duck.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa needed to beat the Netherlands to secure their spot in the semi-finals but failed.
South Africa's loss means India tops Group 2 and advances to the semi-finals.
The winner of the Pakistan-Bangladesh game will finish second in Group 2 and take on Group 1 winners New Zealand in the semi-finals.
